title: Cu + HNO3 - error causes inconsistent absorbance

content.question: To determine the number of moles of Cu in the sample of the mixture, the students measured the absorbance of known concentrations of Cu(NO3)2(aq) using a spectrophotometer. A cuvette filled with some of the solution produced from the sample of the mixture was also tested. The data recorded by one student are shown in the table above. On the basis of the data provided, which of the following is a possible error that the student made?

choices.label: The Cu(NO3)2(aq) from the sample of the mixture was not diluted properly.
The spectrophotometer was calibrated with tap water instead of distilled water.
The student labeled the cuvettes incorrectly, reversing the labels on two of the solutions of known concentration.
The spectrophotometer was originally set to an inappropriate wavelength, causing the absorbance to vary unpredictably.

content.answer: The student labeled the cuvettes incorrectly, reversing the labels on two of the solutions of known concentration.

skill.text: 6.G: Explain how potential sources of experimental error may affect the experimental results.
